00050 /// String describing quant method
00051 #define QUANTBIRDSEEDV1 "birdseed-v1"
00052 
00053 class QuantBirdseedv1 : public QuantBirdseed {
00054 
00055   public:
00056 
00057     /** 
00058      * What version of the BRLMM algorithm are we implementing?
00059      * @return version string.
00060      */
00061     std::string getVersion() {
00062         return "1.1";
00063     }
00064 
00065     /** Constructor, currently creates prior estimates from pre-calculated data from R. */
00066     QuantBirdseedv1(double confidenceThreshold, double correctionFactor): QuantBirdseed(confidenceThreshold, correctionFactor)
00067     {
00068         setupSelfDoc(*this);
00069         //setOptValue("het-mult", ToStr(m_Param.m_HetMultiplier));
00070     }
00071 
00072     ~QuantBirdseedv1()
00073     {
00074     }
00075         
00076     /** Fill in our self documentation from current state. */
00077     static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00078         doc.setDocName(QUANTBIRDSEEDV1);
00079         doc.setDocDescription("Do genotyping calls using the Birdseed v1 algorithm.");
00080         doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00081     }
00082   
00083     /** 
00084      * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00085      */
00086     void computeEstimate();
00087 
00088 
00089     /** 
00090      * @brief What is the name of the quantification method?
00091      * @return name of adjuster.
00092      */  
00093     std::string getType() {
00094         return std::string(QUANTBIRDSEEDV1);
00095     }
00096 
00097 
00098     /** 
00099      * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00100      * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00101      */
00102     static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00103 
00104     /** 
00105      * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00106      * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00107      * @return SelfDoc
00108      */
00109     static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00110 
00111     /** 
00112      * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00113      * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00114      * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00115      * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00116      * 
00117      * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00118      * 
00119      * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00120      */
00121     static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00122   
00123     /** 
00124      * How many genotyping calls do we have? Also indicates how many
00125      * samples there are.
00126      *
00127      * @return Number of genotyping calls made.
00128      */
00129     inline size_t getNumCalls() { return m_Calls.size(); }
00130 
00131     /** 
00132      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00133      * @param index - sample of interest.
00134      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00135      */
00136     double getConfidence(unsigned int index) { 
00137         if(index >= m_Confidences.size()) {
00138             Err::errAbort("Asking for call at index " + ToStr(index) + " when Probeset " + 
00139                           m_ProbesetName + " has only " + ToStr(m_Confidences.size()) + " calls.");
00140         }
00141         return m_Confidences[index];
00142     }
00143 
00144     /** 
00145      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00146      * @param genoType -  Genotype of interest.
00147      * @param index - sample of interest.
00148      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00149      */
00150     double getConfGenotype(affx::GType genoType, unsigned int index) {
00151         assert(index < m_Distances.size());
00152         if(genoType == affx::NN) 
00153             return FLT_MAX;
00154         return m_Distances[index][genoType];
00155     }
00156 
00157     /** 
00158      * Get the summary value after transformation for the A and B alleles respectively.
00159      * 
00160      * @param index - Which chip to get values for.
00161      * @param aValue - Filled in with transformed a value.
00162      * @param bValue - Filled in with transformed b value.
00163      */
00164     void getAlleleValues(unsigned int index, double &aValue, double &bValue) {
00165         assert(index < m_AValues.size());
00166         assert(m_AValues.size() == m_BValues.size());
00167         aValue = m_AValues[index];
00168         bValue = m_BValues[index];
00169     }
00170 
00171     /** 
00172     * Get the summary value names for the A and B alleles respectively.
00173     * 
00174     * @param aName - Filled in with a value name.
00175     * @param bName - Filled in with b value name.
00176     */
00177     void getAlleleValueNames(std::string &aName, std::string &bName)
00178     {
00179         aName = "Signal A";
00180         bName = "Signal B";
00181     }
00182 
00183     /** 
00184      * Get the name of the probeset that these calls are being made for. 
00185      * @return name of probeset.
00186      */
00187     const std::string &getProbeSetName() { return m_ProbesetName; }
00188 
00189     /** 
00190      * Add an expression reporter to output the summary values for each
00191      * allele, residuals, etc.
00192      * 
00193      * @param reporter - the object that will output all summary values.
00194      */
00195     void addExprReporter(QuantMethodReport *reporter) {
00196         m_Reporters.push_back(reporter);
00197     }
00198 
00199     /* Set the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00200     void setQuantExprMethod(QuantExprMethod *qMethod) {
00201         m_QuantMethod = qMethod;
00202     }
00203     /* Get the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00204     QuantExprMethod *getQuantExprMethod() {
00205         return m_QuantMethod;
00206     }
00207 
00208     double getConfidenceThreshold(){ return(m_ConfidenceThreshold);};
00209         void setConfidenceThreshold(double v){m_ConfidenceThreshold=v;};
00210 
00211   // We should test for the format of the file here.
00212   void setPriorFile(const std::string& priorsPath, const string &chipType, 
00213                     std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToLoad, 
00214                     const std::map<std::string, std::pair< int, int > > &specialSnps);
00215 
00216   void setVerbosity(int v)
00217   {
00218     verbosity = v;
00219   }
00220    
00221 //   void setClusterOutFile(const std::string& clusterOutPath)
00222 //   {
00223 //     m_ClusterOutFile = clusterOutPath;
00224 //     m_ClusterOstrm.reset(new ofstream(clusterOutPath.c_str()));
00225 //   }
00226     
00227   double getMinThresh() { return -DBL_MAX;}
00228   double getMaxThresh() { return m_ConfidenceThreshold;}
00229 
00230   virtual bool finish() {
00231       bool result = true;
00232       if (m_ClusterOstrm.get() != NULL) {
00233           Fs::carefulClose(*m_ClusterOstrm);
00234       }
00235       for(size_t i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00236           result = result && m_Reporters[i]->finish(*this);
00237       return result;
00238   }
00239 };
